column1: We’re all in this fight together against #COVID19. So don’t forget: 1. Wear a mask.  2. Wash your hands.  3. Practice social distancing.   #MaskUpMichigan
While our families face a crisis Mitch McConnell stonewalled bipartisan coronavirus relief but is rushing through a Supreme Court nomination.   In 8 days we must win the Senate majority.

Thankful for the frontline workers who have been risking their health this year to save lives.  They have our backs and we need to have theirs.   The Senate must come together find common ground and pass a bipartisan coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/AObOkW22vZ

Grateful for the frontline workers today who administered my COVID test. We all must continue to take this public health crisis seriously. If you have been exposed to the virus or have symptoms find a free testing site here: https://t.co/rA2Od25bFZ

It’s heartbreaking to think of 200000 American lives lost to COVID nearly 7000 of them Michiganders.  For those who have lost someone my heart is with you. For those who are fighting it you’re in my prayers.  We will get through this together.

As the Coronavirus impacts every facet of life millions have lost jobs by no fault of their own. Expanded unemployment benefits have expired and families are struggling.  It’s past time for Congress to come back to the table and pass relief for workers and small businesses.

Millions of Americans are out of a job by no fault of their own.   Simply put the Trump Administration isn’t getting Michigan families the support they need.   We need to put families before politics and come together to pass the next Coronavirus package.

Michiganders rely on the postal service to deliver everything from prescription drugs to ballots. But recent policy changes have slowed down deliveries & hurt families  Our next COVID-19 bill must include relief for the USPS -- for our elections for our communities & for seniors https://t.co/ns97Y9mmQV

During the Coronavirus pandemic the Small Business Administration has been essential in distributing resources and financing loans to Michigan’s business. Today we celebrate the anniversary of its creation and recommit to supporting the small businesses that power our economy. https://t.co/cOw6bKEzyE

Instead of working on passing the next Coronavirus relief package the President is tweeting irresponsibly to undermine our elections.   We're facing the worst public health crisis in a century. And the biggest economic crisis since the Great Depression. Let’s get back to work.

Mitch McConnell's newest “COVID relief bill” protects corporations & cuts support for working families -- 65% cuts to unemployment benefits no protections for renters & not enough funding for schools  Let’s put politics aside to create a package that puts Michigan families first
In January I asked the Administration about its plan to contain COVID-19.  7 months later and they still don't have a plan.  https://t.co/tyBZui5HDp

In November health care is on the ballot. Our COVID-19 response is on the ballot. Our economic recovery is on the ballot.   There’s 100 days until Election Day -- let’s make them count!   Get started here.  https://t.co/kI3K0cIlyn

This is what the election is about: 🩺 Protecting health care for those with pre-existing conditions 👩‍🏭 Supporting small businesses 🏨 Ensuring we have the resources we need to fight COVID-19 🌊 Fighting for the Great Lakes  100 days to go. Let’s win this thing!

Lt. Gov. @Garlin Gilchrist thank you for your support. Your leadership has helped fill a critical gap in our national COVID-19 strategy saving countless lives.   I’ll keep working with you to help secure the resources Michigan needs every step of the way. https://t.co/NUFMBSFl0p

Great to visit TentCraft in Traverse City to learn about how they’re adapting to COVID-19 and how the Paycheck Protection Program helped keep them afloat. The PPP helped save nearly a million jobs in MI & it’s time for the Senate to pass legislation to support our local economies https://t.co/zTpHih8vyn

To keep our families safe and reopen our communities we need to conduct more COVID-19 tests. In the Senate I passed a law to ensure that tests are free and fought to get Michigan needed tests. We’re not through this yet and I’ll be fighting for Michigan every step of the way.

As we recover from COVID-19's impacts health care is at the top of mind for so many Michiganders  Tomorrow I'll be discussing how we can make it more accessible & affordable with Lt Gov @Garlin Gilchrist II @ASlavitt @MaxRichtman & @DianneByrum  RSVP: https://t.co/3MzPGlWBMx

Hospitals in Michigan have been on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic and many are in tough financial situations. The Trump Administration should immediately distribute congressionally allocated funding to hospitals in need.  https://t.co/3FXsZl7300

Michigan recently received over 300000 faulty COVID-19 tests. I just wrote to the Administration demanding they look into the issue and asking how they are going to ensure that we have access to enough usable tests.  https://t.co/o0Hv80zOl9

The African American community makes up 14% of Michigan's population but over 40% of the COVID-19 deaths.  That is unacceptable.  Your ability to get resources shouldn’t depend on your zip code. It’s time for our emergency responses to prioritize help for those who need it most. https://t.co/6g0Lp7gjtf

For generations Michigan has been home to some of the best inventors in the world. During the COVID-19 pandemic that innovation is as important as ever and we’re continuing to lead the way.  https://t.co/SNbUac6AiW
I'm proud of how Michiganders have come together to keep cases of COVID-19 down -- but we're not through this yet.  Wear a mask wash your hands stay home if you're sick. We're all in this together.
You can go to 8 new drive-through COVID testing sites for no-cost testing this weekend. This access is critical to making sure we open up safely. https://t.co/KzF8CP3YhV

100000 lives lost to COVID-19. More than 5300 Michiganders. My heart breaks for them and their families.  May we honor the memories of these lives lost with real substantive solutions -- more testing more access to health care more aid for families in need.
To think that you would withhold funding from a state that has been hit so hard by COVID-19 because Michiganders want to exercise their right to vote is simply outrageous. https://t.co/nozc3uWrGx

Today we’re launching two new ads to highlight what we’re doing to put Michigan first during the COVID-19 crisis.  It comes down to this: Made in America has always worked for Michigan.  https://t.co/dUfAmRK5MC

It is no secret that the pandemic has hit minority communities especially hard.  That’s why @stabenow and I have proposed the COVID-19 Racial and Ethnic Disparities Task Force Act to better direct critical resources. https://t.co/xS8WeQ7dgK
An effective vaccine is key to fighting the spread of COVID-19. I’m proud that Michigan manufacturing in Kalamazoo is a critical part of this effort. https://t.co/m0sZFcQzF7
Tomorrow at 9 PM join your neighbors in turning on a light outside to honor those who have been affected by COVID-19. #LightUpTheState https://t.co/uIRSMLV0jQ

I joined Senator Debbie @stabenow and Congressman @dankildee for the #SupportFlintGenesee Webinar. Every community needs to know what we are confronting while fighting COVID-19. https://t.co/lLwBWS4y7U

We need to help those that are serving on the frontlines of this pandemic. That's why I proposed the COVID-19 Heroes Fund to make sure they receive a pay increase for putting themselves on the line for each of us.https://t.co/qVBgvAffUY
MSU students in need can apply for a $500 grant from the Support Our Spartans Student Emergency Needs Fund for COVID-19. #GoGreen #SpartansWill https://t.co/Pc4cf4az1u

I was raising the alarms about drug shortages before the Coronavirus pandemic and the Trump administration failed to act.  There is simply no excuse.   I’ll keep pushing to address these shortages and get Americans the medications they need. https://t.co/wl5N3ovB37

There's no question that our essential workers -- those on the front lines of the pandemic -- deserve to be compensated for their critical work. That's why I proposed the COVID-19 Heroes Fund.https://t.co/9OupIhkp1o

The workers on the front lines of the Coronavirus crisis are truly heroes. They’re putting themselves and their families at risk to keep us healthy and our economy afloat.  They deserve more than our thanks. They deserve hazard pay. https://t.co/kwdbUtjnnM

To the health care and essential workers putting themselves on the line during this pandemic -- we owe you a massive debt of gratitude.  That’s why this week I proposed the COVID-19 Heroes Fund to give our frontline workers the compensation they deserve.  https://t.co/2JlnH6fiyp

COVID-19 has highlighted the health disparities that have always been present in our communities. We have to do better.   That’s why I’m going to keep fighting for affordable accessible health care for ALL Michiganders. https://t.co/f6wlmIMdyz

First responders. Nurses. Grocery store clerks. Postal carriers.  Essential workers. They are on the frontlines.  That’s why I’m proposing the COVID-19 Heroes Fund to make sure they get hazard pay for the service they’re providing to our country. https://t.co/Y8SNkAQjSh

There’s no question Coronavirus has upended life for all of Michigan and we have a lot more work to do to protect hardworking families.  Here’s what aid looks like for Michigan and what I’m doing in the Senate to help.https://t.co/ov1RFKaWFV

We're all going to be affected by Coronavirus.  That's why we added a new page to our website with resources for you and your family information about what we're doing in the Senate and ways you can help support your neighbors during this tough time.https://t.co/PzYh3Nko5f

No one dealing with unemployment due to Coronavirus should have to choose between paying their bills or putting food on the table.  This historic aid expansion is a big step to helping working families in Michigan and across the country.  https://t.co/zH9swpvbsh

We have a lot of work ahead to address COVID-19. The final bill passed in the Senate is a big step to give financial aid to:  ✓ Small biz owners ✓ Freelancers ✓ Contractors ✓ Seasonal workers ✓ People who just started/were about to start a job https://t.co/O2oirjPfTE

The American people need solutions to take on the Coronavirus pandemic in Michigan and across the nation. Here’s my immediate three-step plan:  🩺 More medical supplies 🥼 Take care of our health care workforce 🏥 Increase patient capacity in facilities https://t.co/lStUxmwjNH

It's not only humans that are feeling the effects of COVID-19 but our furry friends as well. Contact your local shelter to see how you can help!  Current needs include: ✓ Sanitary supplies ✓ Volunteers ✓ People to foster/adopt https://t.co/2afuwszHWY
Now more than ever it's critical to know the facts about the Coronavirus outbreak how it spreads and what you need to do to stay safe.  https://t.co/DGghd4g8hm

A bill to provide relief for Coronavirus passed the House last night. It's sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk waiting for a vote. The President has already said he will sign it.  Michiganders and the nation can’t wait for solutions. The Senate should have passed it by now.

Many are asking for ways to help those impacted by Coronavirus. Consider donating to these @fbcmich food banks:  https://t.co/5DYp5tnCJC https://t.co/V55x4lhZZ7 https://t.co/Di6TcEbxnv https://t.co/K346IEK1ek https://t.co/SyBJ7xsa2W https://t.co/RC2jYgBNTP https://t.co/y7wVEJBiQI

My number one job is fighting for Michigan.   I won’t rest until we ensure that anyone affected by Coronavirus who is unable to work has the financial assistance they need — and I’m working across the aisle to get results.
